website_summaries.verdict: This affordable coffee container offers users remarkable quality and preservation for an inexpensive price.
pros: Customers appreciate the large capacity of this container
Available in a number of different designs and colors
Airtight seal lets food de-gas without letting oxygen get to beans
cons: Not a vacuum sealed container, as the company advertised

customer_reviews.title: A Tip to Owners
customer_reviews.text: Very fine item- effective, well designed, easy to use and attractive. Suggestion to owners: Do NOT pour the coffee grounds into your Coffeevac . Rather, place the new foil bag ( usually 12 oz size) of coffee into the unit- because: (1) Added freshness protection- without added cost (2) when contents near empty it is easier to scoop out grounds from foil bag and ( 3) if you like to rotate your brand or level of roast-- keeping the grounds in the bag will remind you of exactly what type you are currently using. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Guy

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU WANT A VACUUM SEALED CONTAINER THIS IS NOT WHAT YOU WANT.
customer_reviews.text: This container IS NOT AND WILL NEVER BE a vacuum sealed container. It simply has a ONE WAY valve on the lid which releases the amount of air inside the container with the lid completely placed on the container. To have a true vacuum sealed container it would be necessary to pump out or evacuate the air from within the container after the lid is completely placed on the container. This container does not perform this function. So if you want a plastic container that holds coffee or other dry goods this can do it but don't expect a vacuum sealed container as it is promoted.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coffee fresher than the roaster's bag
customer_reviews.text: I buy four pounds of coffee at a time, from Peet's via Costco. The beans are freshly roasted. I tested the Coffeevac by putting one bag of beans in my grinder. Stored two pounds in the roasters bags in the freezer (wrapped in heavy-duty foil), and stored the other one in the Coffeevac. Used the foil-wrapped roaster's bagged coffee from the freezer first, then the Coffeevac coffee. The Coffeevac coffee (opened last) tasted fresher than the beans stored in the roaster's bag. I'm sold on the Coffeevac for keeping my coffee beans fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Terez

customer_reviews.title: Light weight plastic, flimsy, lid cracked after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these and they are nice, but cheaply made. I called the company to get a new lid and they told me to contact Amazon. They could Have just sent me a lid.... The lid cracked after a few uses and the plastic is lightweight. Would not buy again. Cannot put in dishwasher to clean as the plastic will melt.
customer_reviews.author: XLR8TOR

customer_reviews.title: not a vacuum seal!
customer_reviews.text: This does not vacuum seal. It merely pushes the air out of the top as you push the top on to the base. It feels like there is a vacuum seal because the top seals well and the air can't get in fast enough as you remove the top.
customer_reviews.author: darkhorse

customer_reviews.title: Almost, but no cigar!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it didn't work anymore. My wife loved it, I thought that it was great and we were satisfied with our purchase for almost six months; then a crack developed below the button on the lid. No more "vacuum" all because some cost cutting engineer decided to make the thickness of the plastic just a silly millimeter too thin. This is a two adult household, no children to blame for breakage. There is no warranty or guarantee period and nobody really to contact. The stupid thing is that I would buy one again, If promised that it would not crack in six months.
customer_reviews.author: Markbski

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Gets used daily, I think so of the reviews do not understand the product. So it has a one-way value so that when you close the container, it pushes out the excess air and creates a vacuum seal. There is still air in the container, but no air is allowed in our out. We put our coffee in the container, and we open and close it at least once a day, it is simple to open and close once you get the hang of it. Our coffee stays fresh till the end, and we put in about a week's worth of coffee in the container at a time. If something were to happen to it, I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: tfpala

customer_reviews.title: Traps air in container, NOT a vacuum seal at all
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the appeal is with this product, it is NOT a vacuum seal, and simply stops air flow between air inside and outside. If you have a container that's 1/4 full, it's still 3/4 full of air. I think Airscape is a better solution, it has a plunger that goes inside and displaces air in the container, so if the container is 1/4 full, the plunger displaces and evacuates the 3/4 of the air that was in there and sits flush on the coffee, or whatever. Little pricier, but actually does what it is supposed to do, eliminate air from the container, plus it does it in an elegantly simple way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great container- be careful not to press the button when you don't want!
customer_reviews.text: Love this container for my coffee. I work a California swing shift, and I refuse to drink the 'work' coffee- tastes like muddy water! Anyways, this allows my coffee to stay fresh while I'm at and while I'm away from work. You can hear the air being drawn out of the container when closing and the air being drawn back in upon reopening. Be careful not to carry it by the upper portion of the lid- you may inadvertently press the button and spill the beans. *ba dum, psh*. Also, I wish I would have gotten the half pound variant- a pound of coffee is a lot when you make it in solo batches.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: Airtight, not a vaccuum
customer_reviews.text: This is not a vaccuum container and falsely advertised as such which is why I give it one star. As an airtight product I would rate it at a 4 based one what you get for the price. It creates a pretty good seal for having no clamps and I think is good enough for my usage. The problem is lid can not remove air volume from within the container to create any vaccuum what so ever. As far as a cheap air tight container goes it's pretty decent for the price but don't be fooled into thinking it creates a vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps beans fresh despite not being vacuum sealed
customer_reviews.text: Have a 1lb bag of beans stored in there right now that have been there for about a month. I was really interested to see how well it would perform, and decided to put it to the test. Beans now are at about an 80% quality of what they were when they were initially left in there. Pretty impressive given the bag has been open for a month. This isnt meant for pre-ground coffee, but does an amazing job at keeping beans fresh for quite a while. For $12-15 you should pick it up, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee storage
customer_reviews.text: I wish the bottom was solid blue rather than just frosted, but I think it protects well against light anyway. Much easier to use then the big bag of coffee from the warehouse, the one you have to keep rolling down and resealing. The lid seals nicely, but is easy to get off with a press of the button. Coffee seems to be staying fresh, no complaints from my coffee crazy husband.
customer_reviews.author: SageAlum

customer_reviews.title: Fresh,
customer_reviews.text: It's a great container probably the best. Only reason i am giving 4 star is because there is sticker on top of the lid where i tried to take it of but it's glued sticky. Why would i want to see company's name and email address on the lid each time i use it?
customer_reviews.author: Alpgkatl

customer_reviews.title: Great storage for fresh coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: Great storage for fresh coffee beans. I have a few of these, in two different sizes, to store both whole beans and ground coffee. This most recent purchase was a replacement unit for one that had cracked on the side. Once the container cracks the lids become much more difficult to insert and remove, and the airtight seal become compromised.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Schaller

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Coffee Fresher
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vacuum sealed container for my coffee beans. I’m somewhat of a coffee freak. I grind my coffee beans every morning to have the freshest possible coffee. I also buy expensive Kona coffee so I love the idea of keeping the coffee beans as fresh as possible. I am very pleased that this container has upped my coffee game.
customer_reviews.author: TexasMJo

customer_reviews.title: A could of ridges or octagon/hexagon in the middle part of the container to hold better is recommended
customer_reviews.text: It keeps coffee fresh. However it is kind of unwieldy to handle as it is difficult to hold it with one hand. I bought 2, but dropped one and it broke in to two. So, one star less for making the diameter a bit more than average palm can handle. Should have either made the shape not so smooth and round. A could of ridges or octagon/hexagon in the middle part of the container to hold better is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Storage Container!
customer_reviews.text: With a very convenient button on the top lid to release the vacuum seal upon opening and the same button to out-gas upon closing, this is easily the best container for coffee storage I have ever had. High storage capacity container is also non-translucent and can be kept on a kitchen countertop without the worry of sun exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Patrick Owen

customer_reviews.title: Very thin diameter plastic that will break with very little use.
customer_reviews.text: This is very thin plastic and will break. It would’ve been an excellent product if it was not so thin. I purchased mine five years ago and had to put tape on it to function. It looks sturdy but is not! I’m currently looking for another one
customer_reviews.author: Son of a GV

customer_reviews.title: There is absolutely no vacuum seal provided by this product ...
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely no vacuum seal provided by this product. It is a totally misrepresented item. The cap seals tight to the bottom so I would say it is air tight once placed. But it does not create a vacuum. Also made of a fairly thin, unlikely durable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: What a delight! Love this product! Attractive on our counter. Sturdy plastic. Lid seals tight. There is a small push button on side of lid where your thumb comfortably grasps the top to open. Pushing to open releases the lid and the wonderful smell of fresh coffee. you push the button and reset the lid to close in one fluid motion. Whole lid removes for access.
customer_reviews.author: CanyonCat

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Classy
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Attractive to leave on counter next to your coffee maker. Have to figure out one thing though. Pretty deep so when coffee gets down near the bottom I guess I will have to get a scoop with a longer handle. Would definitely suggest you purchase if you like the freshest coffee beans or grounds.
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Zentgraf

customer_reviews.title: It is rather brilliant in its functional purpose
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how this operated before purchasing this, but I thought I would give it a try. It turned out to work really well. It is a seemingly simple design, yet I still do not fully understand why it is so effective! It is rather brilliant in its functional purpose, which is to keep my roasted coffee beans fresh for long periods of time. I was going to tell my extended family about it, but then I saw that they also had their own! Good container! Get one for your coffee beans too!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Powell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee canister
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee canister! We like to buy our coffee beans pre-ground because it is such a time saver over grinding for each time you make coffee. Also, I get up before my wife and the grinder wakes her up. This truly keeps ground coffee fresh for many days. And it is so simple to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: GPS

customer_reviews.title: Coffeevac
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this higher if it were permissible. This container keeps my coffee fresh until the last scoop. It's simplicity of design is remarkable. I have purchased two so far. One for ground coffee and the other one is used for coffee beans. I can see buying more of these in the future for other items that need to be kept fresh. The price is very reasonable in my opinion. Terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Its the best way to keep coffee fresh
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to grind your beans fresh before each cup of coffee this is a good backup ad you can grind up a large amount of beans and store them in the air-tight container. Its attractive and easy to use. I feel like I'm grinding my beans fresh each time, but don;t have to do it but every week or so.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S. Keir

customer_reviews.title: Great For Koi Treats Too
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my kitchen for coffee but they are great for Koi treats too. I treat my Koi to silkworm pupa, aka Koi crack. It comes in tall skinny bags making it hard to use my measuring cup. Not only does this vacuum seal my Koi crack but the wide mouth makes it easy to measure out just how much I need without making a mess. Hikari silkworm select comes in a 17.6 oz bag which fits perfectly in this container.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: How excited was I going to get about a plastic container for coffee, right? I just wanted something that would possibly keep it fresh. But I got this really slick-looking black cannister that breathes air in and out if you remember to keep your finger on the release latch, and my coffee is happy and I absolutely love the way it "works" and the way it looks. I imagine the price was right too because I don't spend money on stuff that I don't plan to get excited about.
customer_reviews.author: BeeJay

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee storage container
customer_reviews.text: Three years later this is still a great coffee storage container. Love the clear sides so I know when to refill; it gets gently washed by hand and dried overnight before being refilled. I'm getting a second one with a different color lid for decaf.
customer_reviews.author: G Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee (or whatever) container for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine to store my fresh, ground coffee. Does a stellar job for that application however I would imagine it's further applications are virtually endless. Essentially stopping wherever your mind stops. If you're looking for a reliable, airtight & relatively portable container, look no more, this is your last stop! *Clairfying disclaimer* - I originally intended on using this photo to leave a positive review for "Death Wish Coffee Co." as I'm insanely addicted to their coffee, so please disregard the stickers applied to my tube, they don't come with it.
customer_reviews.author: PhunGuy

customer_reviews.title: Placing lid on container does remove air.
customer_reviews.text: The Coffeevac units do really remove air from the container. We place our coffevac units on the counter next to our coffee machine for convenience and to save valuable refrigerator space. We have use 2 now for over a year. One color of container is for regular coffee and the other is for decaff. I believe the containers can also be used for a variety of other products such as sugar or rice for keeping quality.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Air Tight Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This came highly recommended and it didn't disappoint. Very easy to take the lid off, make sure the button is pressed. To close the canister, press and hold the button until the lid is all the way on then let go of the button. Super easy and air tight!
customer_reviews.author: BostonGators

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Except for the Big Sticker Right on Top
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Easy to use and clean, and looks good on my counter with coffee in it. Holds about a lb. of coffee perfectly. My only complaint is they stuck their brand sticker right on the top center and it is stuck on with permanent adhesive so it was not easy to peel off (soak in rubbing alcohol to loosen the adhesive), so I had to spend several minutes fixing that. I love this product other than that. I stuck a chalkboard label on it and it looks great next to my coffee pot.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Guptill

customer_reviews.title: Not a vacuum, but creates strong seal
customer_reviews.text: This is not a vacuum, but creates an airtight seal. When closed, there is no way to suck out the air inside, so not a vacuum. Knocked one star for that. Knocked another star because this was bought for decoration, but there was an ugly sticker on the lid which did not come off cleanly. I tried scraping with plastic, rubbing alcohol and soapy water but could not remove the residue. I used some goof off which removed the residue but ruined the finish on the plastic...
customer_reviews.author: jfoliva

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. I like to put my herbs in these and have gotten 3 of them thus far because they do such a great job of locking in the smell and keeping everything fresh
customer_reviews.author: Janina S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I got a French Press to make coffee each morning instead of the free offering at work. This vacuum sealed container is great - keeps the coffee fresh and is very easy to use. I'm going to look at more products from this manufacturer - they have a full line.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Worrell

customer_reviews.title: Simple concept, seals tightly
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Coffeevacs: one for ground coffee and one for beans. I received several bags of coffee from different relatives for Christmas, so I wanted to make sure my coffee stayed fresh. The Coffeevacs worked beautifully, and they look attractive sitting by the coffeepot. One little button on the side pushes air out as you open or close. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Southern slant

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: As a Costco addict, we end up with big bags of fresh ground coffee and want to enjoy fresh coffee for as long as possible. This provides a great seal and seems to keep the coffee fresh longer than anything else we have tried. It's not quite big enough to hold the entire Costco size bag of ground coffee though so we usually fill this up use up the remaining Costco bag of coffee stored in a Ziplock before breaking into this one. The Tightvac had a cameo appearance in an episode of Ballers Season 1 in the theater room of the party house...they were using it to store their bud so I guess it has that use too.
customer_reviews.author: ATL Native

customer_reviews.title: Makes a reassuring noise
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if my coffee is fresher in this vacuum-domed vessel—not having any equipment beyond my limited senses to measure “freshness”—but it certainly makes a reassuring vacuum-y noise, a kind of shooooosh, when you open and close it. This sound, along with the equally reassuring resistance offered by the lid, makes me feel that my coffee is almost definitely shielded from unnecessary oxidation when it is snugly stored inside this airtight bean sheath. Go ahead. You can easily afford to give yourself this peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: S Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Canister works as described. Lid is easy to remove when you press the button. When putting the lid on you feel air resistance until you press the button. Clearly air tight when closed. Ordered a second canister.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Used Product for the Price of New
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for coffee lovers. Mine came with a smell of coffee and nice rustic scratches that make it look old and antique. Great design!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: great container
customer_reviews.text: excellent solution for coffee whole or ground with the one way exhaust valve it creates a gas outlet that greatly extends coffee freshness this container does not vacuum as in negative pressure per-say it is that you press the button to let air in to pull the lid off and also to put it back on so the vacuum effect comes from it being a very precise fit to be air tight. I can say I am pleased with this purchase the quality is very good to excellent and so much better than a traditional bowl or jar with a press or screw on lid
customer_reviews.author: tekwiz47

customer_reviews.title: Works well but wish it was glass or stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: This tub has been working very well for me so far. The only complaint I have is that it's plastic. I've been trying to switch over to glass or stainless steel but I couldn't find a coffee container I liked and went with this one. It's quiet, I don't wake up my boyfriend while making my coffee, and it's a great size to fit a whole pound of coffee with a little room leftover.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Purchased over 4 years ago and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for freshly ground coffee over 4 years ago, and it still keeps the grounds fresh. No need for those over-priced containers that need to have the CO2 filter replaced every 3-4 months. This is a very proven product and I would buy it again in a heart-beat!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: misleading - Airtight- but no vacuum
customer_reviews.text: was disappointed by how it works. No air is evacuated. when you push down it releases the air that you are compressing by closing the airtight lid but whatever air is in the jar is just trapped there- not evacuated. Silly design. Returning the 2 I bought.
customer_reviews.author: fineshmecker

customer_reviews.title: Functional and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store coffee. We run a swamp cooler in the summer so a lot of our food and drink products get stale. This has protected our coffee perfectly. The design is attractive enough that I don’t mind having it on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Boxedwinemama

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and keeps it fresh!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for several years now and it really keeps the coffee fresh. About 10 times longer than having it in just the coffee can. I also keep mine in the fridge and that also helps.
customer_reviews.author: Heavyleaded

customer_reviews.title: Work Well Keeps Coffee Fresh
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if these would work or not, but they do keep the coffee fresher longer and are as airtight as you could get without removing the air by vacuum. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W. PA

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: I am not pleased with this product. Definitely not a smell proof container. You can still smell whatever you put in it right through the container
customer_reviews.author: Jval

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: cannot pull up stopped working difficult for small hands took me half hour to fiddle with it. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: art streppa

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! They allow me to keep my coffee at room temp, and keep it FRESH. I bought two colors, one for regular grounds and one for decaf. LOVE IT. Aesthetic and effective. It's fun when the lid glides off, too. When my roommate who had these moved, I replaced these first thing--didn't want to live without them!
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I make iced coffee at home and I bought the canister to keep my mocha coffee fresh. It’s been over a month and the coffee grounds are still fresh. It still taste and smell great.
customer_reviews.author: Krashtian

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Coffee finally!
customer_reviews.text: I've been keeping my coffee in a Folgers container for about 4 years now and recently visited family who had this awesome vacuum sealed coffee container - i LOVE It and had to buy it right away! It arrived before we returned from our trip and i'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather B

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This container definitely keeps my coffee beans fresher! I have used other products before, but this one is the best/cheapest one so far. Moreover, it is so easy to clean, and it does not hold the smell of coffee for a long time after you finish it, so you can use this for other bag of coffee immediately. If you are freaking about the coffee smell residing will change the smell of the new coffee you put, this is very important (coffee nerd-guilty! :))
customer_reviews.author: Yvz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: When I p pop the lid on this black beauty I can smell the rich aroma of the coffee. Even more so than with some more expensive metal canisters. If you want to protect your beans, this is the way to go. Franks still should be stored in the fridge. Why, yes, I did watch "There's Something About Mary" again tonight. Why do you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Spalding W. Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my coffee fresh and smells awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to keep my coffee fresh and came upon the Coffeevac! It works exactly as stated, my coffee is fresh and smell awesome when I open the container. I picked the clear one so I could see how much coffee was in it. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: L Link

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Everyone raves about this to me!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep my coffee in at the daycare where I work because one of my kids has to take me to get coffee each morning. He can carry this and if dropped the lid stays on and it has yet to crack. I think more than 1 pound of coffee could fit in here but not sure about 2. Definitely keeps it fresh though since it sometimes takes me a few weeks to go through this since I don't drink it every day despite my student's best effort. It's been dropped and rolled and the lid never comes off but is easy to slip off once the button is pushed.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Eisenhour

customer_reviews.title: They work perfect for coffee and keep the beans very fresh
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge coffee addict. Mostly purchasing Single Origin Coffees' from various roasters in the area. I've got a couple of these, will be looking at getting more as needed. They work perfect for coffee and keep the beans very fresh, mostly I put the beans in the container themselves, and place some nice looking cards to keep track of the bean, roaster, and roasted date. Sometimes (especially with smaller bags) I'll place the bag in the container, just to keep cleaning easier. I could see someone using these for all sorts of practical reasons, cereal, grains, trail mix, etc.
customer_reviews.author: T. Abele

customer_reviews.title: While it was a little more than I'd like to pay for such products
customer_reviews.text: While it was a little more than I'd like to pay for such products, its absolutely worked as advertised. While not completely air/smell proof on the level of sealed mylar, it does seal pretty effectively and contain coffee or other organic products admirably. It won't make you unaware whats inside if you sniff at it while its closed, but does keep freshness and smell from wafting away
customer_reviews.author: JJ Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Handy for spliting large bags of coffee
customer_reviews.text: The 1 lb containers are the same diameter, double the height, compared to the 1/2 lb containers. I use these larger containers when I split a large bag of beans from a wholesale club. Then I store them in a fridge and transfer the beans that I will be using to hummus containers or salsa jars.
customer_reviews.author: NigelDH

customer_reviews.title: Great cansiter
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest to keep coffee in and still have space in cabinet. Every time you open it you can hear the vac sound. Which tells me it’s keeping it from getting air. No more hassle with the canister the coffee comes in and spilling grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle but keeps coffee fresh for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I have recently cut my coffee intake and so I needed some good container to keep coffee fresh for a long time. This container does the job and looks good in the cupboard. I have not cleaned it after use yet but given the simplicity of the design i expect that to be easy. Stores about 1-1.5lb of coffee. worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage after making coffee, too!
customer_reviews.text: We actually use this after making coffee! It's the right size for a countertop compost container and the seal means no unpleasant odors! We fill it with spent grounds and vegetable scraps, and empty it outside every couple days. A chop stick held across the top makes it easy to tap out the portafilter basket after drawing a shot of espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely -- but know how it works...
customer_reviews.text: The Tightvac is one of the best coffee containers I've ever used, but the part of its name that counts is the "Tight," not the "Vac." It can't be aspirated or pumped out to provide a true low-pressure (low-oxidation) environment. But it does feature a pressure release that gives an EXTREMELY tight seal, which prevents exchange of air between inside and outside, and also means that coffee won't spill if the canister tips. The ultra-high-end coffee connoisseur may prefer a true vacuum container, but for the thoughtful everyday coffee drinker, the Tightvac is easily worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: panterazero

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee container
customer_reviews.text: As I wrote in another review - when I still see things on my WISH LIST I think I have not ordered them and then when I order again and I get two. I love this coffee container. This way I leave the coffee container on the kitchen counter and always know if I need to purchase more coffee. The containers were so nice I kept them both - and one stores my small dogs food and opening large enough to easily put coffee in coffee pot and dry food in dog bowl. It does read on top for COFFEE but my dog cannot read so he does not know his food is in this container. Love love them.
customer_reviews.author: Betty L.

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: I now have 3 of these and that's because they work and they are awesome. Keeps my coffee fresh way longer than it should be and they're super easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Pleepleus

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how much it works to keep the coffee fresh. I drink it pretty fast. I like it because it easily holds a pound, looks nice and is easy to put the coffee in and get the lid on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This a great, simple product. Easy to use and the partial vacuum it creates definitely keeps my coffee fresher for much longer. Nothing will keep your beans fresh forever but this seemed to keep my beans in the sweet spot for about 2.5 weeks as opposed to them seeming fresh for about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle VA

customer_reviews.title: yes!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bit of a coffee snob, and I have great appreciation for a canister that keeps more than a pound of locally-roasted Zambia coffee beans fresh for a month. I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Cloud

customer_reviews.title: The vacuum seal inspires confidence and my coffee stays super fresh. The button mechanism is much more elegant ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything I wanted in coffee storage for the right price. I bought 2, one for work and one for home. This vacuum seal container perfectly fits a pound of ground coffee. The vacuum seal inspires confidence and my coffee stays super fresh. The button mechanism is much more elegant than any kind of spring based setup. Simple shiny black color fits in with most kitchen aesthetics. I use a single cup machine at work and at home and don't go beyond 2 cups a day, so a pound last a month. Now thanks to my Tightvac my grounds stay fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Gianesin

customer_reviews.title: I'd gave it 5 stars but it feels pretty cheap given it's entirely plastic
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my freshly ground beans. I'd gave it 5 stars but it feels pretty cheap given it's entirely plastic.Also the canister can be slippery to grip. Update-bought mine in November of 17 and the kids has cracked now. No longer seals at all. Also looks like a crack is starting on the container part now. Not sure why it cracked...
customer_reviews.author: Matt N

customer_reviews.title: Leave sticker intact!
customer_reviews.text: You will have to leave the sticker on the lid. It's impossible to remove cleanly without damaging the plastic coating. Used adhesive remover and it smudged so badly it just looks dirty. Terrible appearance on countertop. Product quality ok.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Effective at sealing coffee freshness in and stupid guests out!
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool. Keeps coffee fresh. Frustrates guests who can't get it open because they don't know you have to push the pressure release button. We laugh at them, and then they don't come back, which we like, because we prefer to drink our coffee alone. It's a win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff of the North

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Keeps the coffee fresh. Update: I should have updated my review on the product a while ago. A couple of weeks after I wrote the review the lid got a crack in it, then on two sides and became useless. Really too bad. It was nice while it lasted. I unfortunately can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aus

customer_reviews.title: Top portion developed a split
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these for about two years before the top portion developed a crack. Decided to buy another one about six months ago. This one ALSO developed a split about 2+ inches long in the top portion. This reduces the vacuum seal. Liked the product when it worked, but poor design/materials leading to cracks/splits makes this not a product to buy.
customer_reviews.author: WJ

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Stores coffee beans and does not leak out smell, so my beans are noticeably fresher than beans that have not been stored in this product. I am a bit frugal though and I think price is a lil high for an item made of simple design and plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lazybones

customer_reviews.title: This really works to keep coffee beans fresh
customer_reviews.text: This does what it says - I have had a (ever-dwindling) pound of fresh-roasted coffee beans in there for over a week and the remaining beans still smell fresh and have a shiny appearance, and when ground produce a fresh-tasting cup of coffee. No comparison to a screw-top jar. This really works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic, Not Easy to Operate
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this, however, was disappointed once received. Is NOT as sleek looking as pictured (black on black), very cheap plastic looking, plus HORRIBLE sticker on top, goof off took it off, but created "stains" ... Not counter worthy. Biggest pain is that it's not easy to open/close. Two-handed operation which I wouldn't want to deal with in the early morning hours. Would return, but not worth the hassle and cost to ship back.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBridein11

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely ingenious design. Though it only creates a ...
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely ingenious design. Though it only creates a partial vacuum, it does seem to be keeping my coffee fresher. I drink 2 cups a day so a pound of Starbucks lasts me over a month. I am a coffee snob and i can tell you, the last of the bag tastes very nearly as fresh as when first opened.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Smith

customer_reviews.title: It has kept store bought coffee so incredibly fresh tasting for over a month (husband buys huge bags) and is perfect for de-gassing fresh roasted coffee if you are a ...
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? It has kept store bought coffee so incredibly fresh tasting for over a month (husband buys huge bags) and is perfect for de-gassing fresh roasted coffee if you are a home roaster (being the coffee snob that I am, husbands store bought isn’t up to par 😄). So happy I invested in these!
customer_reviews.author: rababe

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coffee fresh
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as expected. So far happy with it. Do not squeeze container or lid too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: ALERT: Genius Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to buying and making my own coffee with a grinder/brewer appliance and I learned that I'd need to take good care of my fresh grinds. I saw this while searching for the best item to do the job. Once I read the description it didn't take me long to place the order and I couldn't be happier with owning it. Will probably buy another one (or two!) so that I can use it for storing coffee beans and/or loose tea.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Bogus
customer_reviews.text: Won’t even close properly. Definitely is not smell proof if that is what you are looking for. Got so frustrated I broke the thing even worse and now I can’t send it back.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence garner

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic and weak vacuum seal
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as durable as it should be. The top will crack and render the entire container useless. Should sell replacement tops!
customer_reviews.author: marc powell

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about this simple container
customer_reviews.text: If you like your coffee beans fresh, and why wouldn't you, then store them in this thing! I was skeptical at first as it just seemed like cheap plastic. However i was surprised to see that it held up to being dropped all the while keeping the lid in place. The lid fits so perfectly that without engaging the pressure relief, you will have a difficult time getting it on. This size container comfortably fits one bag of whole bean coffee easily.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sourdough starter storage
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this. I keep my sourdough starter in it on the counter. It can breath and release gasses without being open to air and drying out. And no issues with bugs or flies
customer_reviews.author: Clarasbel

customer_reviews.title: doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: still had smells coming out of it does not work at all top broke after a week of use cheaply made two thumbs down 0/10
customer_reviews.author: Noba

customer_reviews.title: Functional and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I keep this filled with a pound of finely ground Trader Joe's Bay Blend (my fave) on my desk at work to use with my new Aeropress. It's a real treat to open this beautiful container (LOVE this cobalt blue) and have the smell of freshly ground coffee fill the air. Also useful to know how much coffee is inside without having to open it, and the color is dark enough to keep the beans inside fresh. Really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Diva

customer_reviews.title: lid cracked after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: This coffee container overall works well, however durability is a problem. After 11 months of daily use, the lid has developed a crack. Duct tape will be gracing this soon, but next time I order something like this it will be metal or ceramic
customer_reviews.author: Betty W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cigars
customer_reviews.text: This size will hold perfectly 20 Churchill cigars, add a humidipak 69 and your sticks will be perfect for at least 9-12 mos
customer_reviews.author: C. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Description, not vacuum seal
customer_reviews.text: This is not a vacuum seal container, nor is it completely air tight. The air release button is more gimmicky than functional. Nothing more than a semi-airtight container for 1 lb of coffee grounds. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Neat, nice design and pretty
customer_reviews.text: I got the one with the blue flowers, really like this product to store my coffee beans. Very aesthetic and simple and clean design.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Cavernous!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to keep my coffee fresh at work (a necessity as even in Seattle, the office coffee still manages to be horrible). This thing is huge! You can fit a full pound of coffee still in the bag into it. If you emptied the coffee into the Tightvac, there would be plenty of room for another 1/2 pound. Keep that in mind. The container seals well, offers a satisfying "whoosh" when the lid is opened or closed, and my coffee stays fresh for much longer than if it was just left in a bag. For the money, I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Young

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a good coffee holder for the price. It's light thin plastic, with a button to easily push each time you lift open or close the lid, to keep it "vacuumed." It's a bit bigger than you need for a pound of coffee, but that's ok. What's strange is that the directions say to keep the inside clean. How can you keep the inside clean if you always have coffee beans in it? I considered putting the beans in a bag than in the container, but I'm just keeping the beans only in it. UPDATE - 4 years later and still using. Cap has loosened just a bit but still works great.
customer_reviews.author: jmtkTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This looks great. The container doesn't really seal like you'd think, but it's perfect for what I bought it for, coffee. There's no actual rubber or plastic seal. It appears to be a very close tolerance between the lid and the container body. That requires you to push the pressure relief button to put it on and take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Patrick

customer_reviews.title: This item works pretty well at keeping coffee/espresso fresh
customer_reviews.text: This item works pretty well at keeping coffee/espresso fresh. I bought one and my husband bought one. His lid wasn't going on correctly for a while (it seemed tight and didn't slide on like mine did). Then finally one day it worked. About a week later I discovered that there was a crack in his down the side of the top. Not sure how that happened, but that would explain the top being able to slide on better. He bought a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L Edinger

customer_reviews.title: It’s does a great job of folding coffee
customer_reviews.text: It’s does a great job of folding coffee... but I question the vacuum that it states it gives. Nice to have but don’t pour out it. Also if you don’t do the shopping in the house I would have gotten the clear base so she could see how much coffee was left.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Vacuum Canister
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a canister to store my coffee beans air tight for freshness. This one holds a full bag of beans from the market and is very easy to seal and unseal. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Boutwell

customer_reviews.title: Does What it is Supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The air tight container keeps the oils in your ground coffee, so that the flavor lasts that much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth trying.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husbands favorite coffee and it really keeps it fresh. Am sure it’s fantastic for loose tea as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cook48

customer_reviews.title: My fav canister of all time only one size up -- i like the 2 lb!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome totally wonderful functioning canisters that keep the air out and ease for going in and out to get resource. They work for just about everything you could imagine. They are truly solid, clean easily and do hold the air out and the food in. I use them for tea and love them.... only I settled on the 2 lb size for most of my storables and dry foods such as tea, rice, noodles... have fun and they are really beautiful aren't they? I think they add to my counter design and match my kitchen curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Anahata G.

product_meta.title: Coffeevac 1 lb - The Ultimate Vacuum Sealed Coffee Container, Black Cap & Body
product_meta.description:
Color:Black Cap & Body

The Ultimate 1 lb Coffee Container

The CFV2 was specifically designed for 1 pound of Coffee. Tea people - it will hold 10 to 16 oz of Darjeeling and green teas. Coffeevac's have a unique patented vacuum closure system, our 2 way valve, allows the carbon dioxide from the beans to slowly escape, without letting oxygen in. Solid and tinted models protect light sensitive beans and tea leaves. Coffeevac's save you money and guarantee smooth rich coffee flavor. The multiuse 16 oz Coffevac can also be used for most dry & wet goods. Store conveniently on the countertop, in the pantry, the fridge or freezer.



Is the Coffeevac patented system easy to use? How does it work?

Yes - To open simply push the press button on the cap, and pull the cap off. To close, push the press button, no need to pump, push cap down onto the body and with this motion the cap volume of air is eliminated, creating a vacuum seal, it’s that simple!

Is this a vacuum sealed container?

The United States patent office granted us a patent on a vacuum container – Our Vacs create a partial vacuum – The same volume of air as the cap is removed and for human purposes this is enough to keep most goods fresh and edible for long periods of time. For the engineers out there technically speaking there is no vacuum until the cap is pulled upward without pressing the button. Either way the Vacs will keep goods fresher for longer and prevent weevil & bug infestations. This reality is why globally we have sold over 10 million Vacs without advertising. No batteries or electricity required!

Are the Vacs smell proof?

The Coffeevac patented system is able to preserve goods for 1 year and beyond by allowing products to breath and degas. Almost all food goods are smell proof inside the Vacs , however some products like freshly roasted coffee and medical herbs may degas, leaking there odor. Our 2 way valve allows gas build up to slowly escape – without letting oxygen in. This is one of the main reasons it can preserve goods for long periods of time.

Note:Medical herbs that are sticky & smelly we recommend using a strong zip lock bag inside the Vac. This helps contain the smell and keeps the area clean where the body and the cap meet. This is essential to create a smell proof situation. The sticky resin often created by these products can compromise the open and close system, causing the caps to crack when opening and closing under such pressure of a glue like substance. Keep these areas free from resin buildup. Use a product like Grundge off. Thus maximizing the efficiency of use and longevity of the Vacs.

Is it moisture and oxygen free?

Yes the Tightvac patented system keeps moisture and oxygen out – these elements cannot enter the container unless you decide to take the cap off.

Are the Vacs durable? How long will they last?

Yes the Vacs are made with NSF & FDA approved PS # 6, this plastic is very strong. These days shipping methods are very rough, packages being thrown, automated systems dropping huge parcels on top of smaller ones. If your Vac arrives damaged please report this IMMEDIATELY UPON RECIEPT for a part or full replacement.

My cap seems loose? 

We offer 10 different sizes and 3 styles of Vacs – Solid – Clear and Tint. Often a Solid & Tint Vac will have a slightly looser fitting cap then a clear model. It is a misconception that a tighter fitting cap is working better or holding more of a seal. Loose caps function just as well and will tighten with time and use.

How should I clean the Vacs?

Hand wash only - Use mild or natural cleaners. Do not microwave or put in dishwasher. Always keep the interior of the cap and the top of the container clean. This will ensure easy open and closure.

What does NSF International certified mean?

Recognized by regulatory agencies at the local, state, federal and international level, NSF International certification demonstrates that a product complies with all standard requirements. NSF conducts yearly manufacturing facility audits and product testing to verify that the product continues to comply with the standards set by the FDA. In our case all packaging claims have been tested. The plastics we use have been tested for food safety and our manufacturing facility has been visited and complies with all standards. See the complete listings and info at NSF.org
feature_bullets: Europe’s # 1 coffee container - Maintains aroma and rich, full coffee flavor
Patented system creates a partial vacuum seal and keeps Coffee - Fresher for Longer
Multiuse - Allows products to breathe and degas, without letting oxygen in
NSF - Tested and Certified, FDA Approved – Food Grade - Airtight, Moisture free and recyclable
Coffee grounds or beans – 16 oz. / 500g / 1.85 liter / Dimensions: 7-3/4" tall x 4-7/8" diameter (19.5 cm x 12 cm)
